pr_title: Do not add attestations from different forks to produced block

timeline.message: Do not add attestations from different forks to produced block

timeline.bodyText:
I think we should simplify this further to just store the randao rather than spending time calculating the entire shuffling seed.  If the randao matches, the shuffling seed will as well.  So just:
get_randao_mix(state, compute_epoch_at_slot(attestation.getData().getSlot()))
timeline.author: ajsutton

replies.author: ajsutton

replies.bodyText: Following conversation with Proto, sticking with seed probably does make sense - just make sure that we calculate the seed for the block only once, not once per attestation or group.
replies.author: ajsutton

timeline.bodyText:
We should apply this filter to the MatchingDataAttestationGroup as a whole rather than to every individual attestation.  If the attestation data matches and the signature is valid (both already checked), then either the entire group can be included, or the entire group can be excluded because they're all pointing to the same block root.
And we should get the randao for the block's state prior to this stream so that we only get it once rather than for every group.
timeline.author: ajsutton
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -126,11 +129,23 @@ public int getSize() {
         .filter(group -> isValid(stateAtBlockSlot, group.getAttestationData()))
         .flatMap(MatchingDataAttestationGroup::stream)
         .limit(attestations.getMaxSize())
+        .filter(attestation -> fromCorrectFork(stateAtBlockSlot, attestation))

replies.bodyText:
The slot of the attestation data is important for the randao mix, so we have to get it for every group. Because different attestation groups might be from different epochs.
Maybe if only attestation groups that point to the last two epochs are valid, we could get the randao mixes for those two epochs, and check if any groups randao mixes match those.
replies.author: cemozerr

replies.bodyText: Applying the filter to the Group as a whole makes sense to me.
replies.author: cemozerr

timeline.author: ajsutton

replies.bodyText: I had forgotten the rule above, i.e. target.getEpoch().equals(compute_epoch_at_slot(attestation.getData().getSlot()), in light of that, what you say makes total sense.
replies.author: cemozerr

timeline.message: Use randao mix instead of the seed
Check randao mix of attestation group

timeline.bodyText: It may be cleaner to just call attestation.saveRandoMix here and have the method do nothing if it already has a randaoMix saved.  Otherwise it takes a bit of reasoning to understand why the absence of an indexed attestation means we need to save randao mix.
timeline.author: ajsutton

replies.bodyText: My bad, I was actually trying to call attestation.getMaybeRandaoMix().isEmpty()
replies.author: cemozerr

replies.bodyText: But your suggestion below makes sense. I'll apply that one.
replies.author: cemozerr

timeline.bodyText: I'm not really a fan of the Maybe in these method names.  I'd be tempted to just move to having a single getRandaoMix which returns an optional and do the orElseThrow in the caller if desired (and same for getIndexedAttestation).
timeline.author: ajsutton

timeline.bodyText: Didn't we circle back round to storing the seed? Sorry, I know I said randao mix but I was overthinking the performance implications I think.  As long as we don't have to calculate a seed for every attestation when producing blocks it will be fine.
timeline.author: ajsutton

timeline.bodyText: Good idea to make this its own class.
timeline.author: ajsutton

timeline.message: Directly call save randao mix method
Revert back to using seed as distinct fork identifier
